Function create_entryCopy item path

pub fn create_entry<I, E>(input: I) -> ExternResult<ActionHash>

Create an app entry. Also see create.

Apps define app entries by registering entry def ids with the entry_defs callback and serialize the entry content when committing to the source chain.

This function creates entries in the local source chain only. The entry will be validated by the local agent and then stored. To publish the entry to the DHT, use additional functions like create_link or emit_signal.

Examples


use hdk::prelude::*;

#[hdk_entry_helper]
#[derive(Clone)]
pub struct Foo(String);

#[derive(Serialize, Deserialize, Debug)]
#[serde(tag = "type")]
pub enum EntryTypes {
    Foo(Foo),
}

// Create a new entry
let foo = Foo("Hello, world!".to_string());
let action_hash = create_entry(EntryTypes::Foo(foo))?;
